snippet: Most major retailers saw their same-store sales rise in May as consumers bought goods despite concern about the overall economy.
abstract: Most major retailers saw their same-store sales rise in May as consumers bought goods despite concern about the overall economy; Thomson Reuters reports sales at stores open at least a year at major retail chains rose 3.9 percent in May compared with May 2011.
lead_paragraph: Most major retailers saw their same-store sales rise in May as consumers bought goods despite concern about the overall economy.

headline.seo: Most Retailers See Rise in Same-Store Sales
headline.main: Many Retailers’ Sales Rose in May Despite Concerns About Economy
headline.print_headline: Many Retailers’ Sales Rose in May Despite Concerns About Economy
